byline.contributor: Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura and Assia Labbas contributed reporting from London, and Katrin Bennhold from Glasgow.
byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE

abstract: British exit polls show Conservative Party of Prime Min David Cameron with big lead in general election, but just short of majority.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron’s party appeared to have won 316 seats, according to the poll, 10 short of the 326 necessary to win an outright majority.

headline.main: Exit Poll Sees Gains for Britain’s Conservatives, but No Clear Winner
headline.print_headline: Exit Poll Sees Gains for Britain’s Conservatives, but No Clear Winner

snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron’s party appeared to have won 316 seats, according to the poll, 10 short of the 326 necessary to win an outright majority.
